item.title: Custom EA Sports NCAA Football 2007 Covers
item.description:
With EA Sports NCAA Football 2007 hitting soon, lots of groups around the internet are using photo shop to create custom covers, fake covers, and gag covers for the game. We've collected the NCAA Football 2007 covers in one Flickr photoset for your enjoyment.

A few samples: (view all online)


     

     


Note: We didn't create *any* of these and cannot verify who may have, so there you go.

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Custom EA Sports NCAA Football 2007 Covers...

item.title: Spartans starter headed to jail
item.description:
After pleading down from 13 charges, including rape and drug charges, and agreeing to cooperate in another drug case, Spartans DB Cole Corey is headed to jail for 2 to 10 years on sexual assault charges.

Corey admitted to taking Ecstasy along with a friend, giving a girl tequila & Ecstasy, and then both of them having sex with her multiple times, but contends the sex was consensual.

Corey originally faced 13 criminal counts, including rape and drug charges, relating to the incident. Prosecutors dropped all but one of the charges when Corey agreed to plead guilty in February to the Ecstasy charge and cooperate in their case against Matthew Peterson, the former track coach at Tecumseh High.

The 2002 incident was unrelated to a series of sex-and-alcohol parties Peterson hosted for students, including minors, in the summer of 2003, authorities said. Peterson this month was sentenced to up to seven years in prison after pleading guilty to four felony charges.

Corey, 21, who had been projected as a possible starting defensive back for Michigan State this fall, was taken into custody immediately. He was suspended from the team, university spokesman Terry Denbow said in a statement released Thursday.

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Spartans starter headed to jail...

item.title: Tressel gets contract extension
item.description:
Ohio State football coach Jim Tressel landed a big contract extension, bumping his pay this season to nearly $2.4 million & securing his place at Ohio State through 2012.

Buckeye Commentary says it's exorbitant, but that's football.

It's gaudy and exorbitant but deserved in today's marketplace of out of control coaching salaries. There was no official comment from Lloyd Carr but no doubt he is demoralized and being consoled by loved ones.

I don't particularly like Tressel's style as a coach, but he's defintely got Michigan's number and it's impossible to argue with his success so far in Columbus.

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Tressel gets contract extension...

item.title: UCLA-USC to don home-home jerseys?
item.description:
Apparently USC football coach Pete Carroll approached UCLA football coach Karl Dorrell at the Nike Camp about returning to the tradition of both teams wearing home jerseys for this year's annual rivalry game in the Rose Bowl.

The last time the two teams both won their home jerseys was 1982 - a UCLA win in the Rose Bowl.

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on UCLA-USC to don home-home jerseys?...

item.title: Fanblogs tops 1 million page views for 2006
item.description:
One more on the topic of continued growth, and then I'll put away our horn for a while.

I want to thank our loyal readers and new guests for helping us set blow our previous traffic records out of the water. This week, Fanblogs topped 1 million page views for 2006. Unbelievable! Last year, it took us more than half the year to reach that plateau!

Since we got this thing started in 2003, we've been lucky enough to share over 7.2 million page views with you. That just blows me away.

We've got big plans for this year, but I want to say thank you to everyone who's taken the time to read our posts, share your thoughts, subscribe to our feeds, and come back for more. Y'all rock!

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Fanblogs tops 1 million page views for 2006...

item.title: Fanblogs reaches 7200+ feed subscribers
item.description:
When we first launched our syndicated college football feeds in RSS in August 2003, we really didn't know what to expect. And then, eight months ago, we were blown away to see over 3,000 subscribers to our main site feed.

Today, we are proud to announce that our main site feed now has over 7,200 subscribers. Wow!

 

If your looking to join the RSS revolution, please check out the Fanblogs site feed or any of the 100+ college football feeds available through Fanblogs. And if you are looking to include Fanblogs headlines or content on your own site, please check here for some pointers!

Thank y'all so much for your continued support. We're looking forward to some big changes & an incredible year!

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Fanblogs reaches 7200+ feed subscribers...

item.title: Irish to schedule home games in Dallas, Florida, Big Easy
item.description:
Notre Dame AD Kevin White confirmed that the Irish are looking to schedule future "home" games across the country. White confirmed that UND was negotiating with officials in Dallas, Jacksonville, Orlando, and New Orleans to host the games.

"I think it was real important for us to go back to our roots and behave more like an independent -- go back to the coach Rockne barnstorming era if you will."

But the move to this regional format does not necessarily mean that the Irish will be playing regional powers.

"We have enough heavyweights on the schedule," he said. "We need to have a schedule that's conducive to success."

...

"We need to schedule in a way it puts us in a position to win national championships. We could have a great football team and schedule ourselves out of a championship. You can schedule yourself in, you can schedule yourself out," he said. "The last time I checked, the most important thing here is to try to win national championships. That's what we're trying to do."

I love the idea of seeing Notre Dame playing in Superdome or Cotton Bowl for a home game, but the concept loses something if they're playing a Sun Belt team, for example. Don't ya think?

Here's my hypothetical of how this could look:
- Notre Dame vs Navy in Jacksonville (a big Navy town)
- Notre Dame vs Arizona State in Dallas
- Notre Dame vs Oklahoma in New Orleans
- Notre Dame vs Stanford in Orlando

Not too boring, but not terribly exciting, either. Now let's spice that hypothetical up a bit:
- Notre Dame vs Florida in Jacksonville
- Notre Dame vs Texas in Dallas
- Notre Dame vs Alabama in New Orleans
- Notre Dame vs FSU in Orlando

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Irish to schedule home games in Dallas, Florida, Big Easy...

item.title: Aggies recruit charged with raping 13-year-old girl
item.description:
New Mexico State University has pulled the scholarship for incoming WR Cornell Burbage II following his arrest on charges of raping a 13-year-old girl.

Burbage is charged with second-degree rape and two counts of second-degree sodomy -- felonies that carry a maximum sentence of up to 10 years in prison, said Lt. James Curless of the Lexington Police Department. Curless said the girl checked herself in to St. Joseph East Hospital Sunday for a rape examination. It was after that exam, which typically includes a DNA test, that police identified Burbage as a suspect. Curless declined to say whether any physical evidence collected implicated Burbage.
© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Aggies recruit charged with raping 13-year-old girl...

item.title: Marshall coach quits for job at... Chik-Fil-A?
item.description:
This is the strangest story I've heard in a while: Marshall TE coach quits team to work at Chik-Fil-A.

Shaine Miles comments on his move:

"This is a move that my wife, Vanessa, and I felt was best for our family. We both love this area and having the opportunity to stay here and work for a great company really appealed to me," Miles said. "Marshall has become a second home for us and is near and dear to our hearts. I really enjoyed working for coach Snyder this past year and I appreciate everything he has done for me and my family. I am confident that he will lead the Herd to new heights."

Don't get me wrong, I do love Chik-Fil-A. I mean, that pickle in the middle just does it for me. And he will be off on Sundays, but...leaving a college coaching gig to fry nuggets???

Former Mashall captain on the 1992 national title team, Phil Ratliff, will return to the Herd to replace Miles.

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Marshall coach quits for job at... Chik-Fil-A?...

item.title: Bye-bye "World's Largest Outdoor Cocktail Party"?
item.description:
Apparently the UGA President wants to do away with the phrase, "World's Largest Outdoor Cocktail Party" for the Florida-Georgia game.

According to Michael Adams, he has spoken to CBS and the City of Jacksonville, but that "CBS has made it clear it is within its rights to use the tag line if it wants to."

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Bye-bye "World's Largest Outdoor Cocktail Party"?...

item.title: Football, eh?
item.description:
The NCAA will again consider proposals to permit schools from outside the USA to join.

After licensing a new football bowl game in Toronto last month, the NCAA will study the possibility of allowing schools from outside the United States to become members.

Canada's University of British Columbia and St. Clair College have expressed interest in joining the association. The NCAA's highest policy-making group, the executive committee, asked for recommendations on the issue to be delivered in October.

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Football, eh?...

item.title: Texas to unveil largest HD scoreboard in country
item.description:
BevoSports has word on the new 134 ft x 55 ft high-definition LED scoreboard being installed at Royal-Memorial Stadium. The new scoreboard will be the largest HD scoreboard in America.

This addition is part of a large overhaul of DKR Texas Memorial Stadium, including $8 million in audio-visual improvements and $150 million to renovate the north end of the stadium to allow for 90,000+ in seating capacity.
© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Texas to unveil largest HD scoreboard in country...

item.title: Violation charges against Gators just sour grapes?
item.description:
The allegations of recruiting violations against the Florida Gators in the case of C.J. Spiller has turned out to be nothing of the sorts.

The reality is this: UF officials learned on Feb. 1 that Tebow had visited Spiller, investigated the situation and on the same day forwarded the information to the Southeastern Conference and the issue was resolved months ago.

"I asked our coaches about it, and I sat down and talked to Tim Tebow about it," UF associate athletic director for compliance Jamie McCloskey said Tuesday. "We reported the information to the SEC. We did not feel there were any (NCAA) violations and the SEC agreed. The conclusion is it's a non-issue."

Tigerpundit wants to know why are Clemson coaches and officials pushing the story?

Maybe Jeff Quinton was on the money and this is sour grapes over Florida signing Mike McIntosh.

One question remains: Did Florida discover this on their own? Did Clemson tip Florida off? Or, CJ Spiller himself wonders, was it FSU that first raised questions about Tebow's visit?

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Violation charges against Gators just sour grapes?...

item.title: Hokies add series with Nebraska
item.description:
Virginia Tech announced Thursday that the Hokies have signed a home-and-home series with Nebraska in 2008 and 2009. Tech will travel to Lincoln for a September 20, 2008 game while Nebraska will visit Blacksburg on September 19, 2009. The series was scheduled to replace a series with Wisconsin that the Badgers wanted out of in those same two seasons.

ESPN tried to set up the Wisconsin series for 2006 and 2008 but those negotiations foundered as well. The two schools are still trying to arrange a future series, according to news reports. Nebraska and Virginia Tech have only met once previously. The Huskers defeated the Hokies in that Orange Bowl game 41-21 following the 1996 season.

© www.fanblogs.com

Comment on Hokies add series with Nebraska...
